intro: Cybianthus microbotrys, commonly known as the dwarf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Cybianthus microbotrys is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
